p: 9. The referral-structure of a job (1): the “what-for” (τὸ τέλος). Say I want to make a bookcase. The product I want to make—the bookcase—is the “what-for” of the tool. In addition, that product itself has its own what-for and its own usefulness: it’s for holding books. I undertake the job to produce something of use, and with that comes the whole context of referrals that make up the job to be done.
